page.title: 17SHIPTON QUARRY
page.content: The quarry and cement works are both owned by Blue Circle. The quarry has an area of 27 acres and is 60 feet deep, they quarry limestone and clay which makes an almost perfect mix for cement. The works employ 103 persons including millers, chemists, instrument engineers and other jobs,but in 1975 they had 300 jobs and produced 3 times as much. In 1984 they payed 12,000,000 pounds in redundancy money. The quarry produces 360-400 tons a day, which goes to large companies such as Redland Roof Tiles. The factory was built in 1929 and unfortunately they are still using a lot of 1920's technology. They may close down because of bills, they pay for coal (22,000tons), gypsum (8,000tons) and 15,500,000 units of electrity. They work from 12pm-6am to get cheap rate power.
